    • Method Detail

      • parseNumber

        public static Number parseNumber(String s,
                                 @NonNull
                                 NumberFormat numberFormat,
                                 @NonNull
                                 TemporalFormat temporalFormat,
                                 @NonNull
                                 ZoneId timeZone,
                                 @NonNull
                                 TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                 @NonNull
                                 ZonedDateTime epoch,
                                 @NonNull
                                 Map<String,Boolean> booleanStrings,
                                 @NonNull
                                 List<? extends Number> booleanNumbers)
        Parses the given string as a number.

        This method tries first to parse the string as a numeric value, using the given decimal formatter; then, if that fails, it tries to parse it as an alphanumeric temporal, using the given parser, and converts it to a numeric timestamp using the given time unit and the given epoch; and if that fails too, it tries to convert it to a boolean number.

        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse, may be null.
        numberFormat - the NumberFormat to use to parse numbers; cannot be null.
        temporalFormat - the parser to use if the string is an alphanumeric temporal; cannot be null.
        timeZone - the time zone to use; cannot be null.
        timeUnit - the time unit to use to convert the alphanumeric temporal to a numeric timestamp; cannot be null.
        epoch - the epoch to use to convert the alphanumeric temporal to a numeric timestamp; cannot be null.
        booleanStrings - A mapping between booleans and words.
        booleanNumbers - A mapping between booleans and numbers.
        Returns:
        a Number or null if the string was null or empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string cannot be parsed.

      • narrowNumber

        public static <N extends Number> N narrowNumber(Number value,
                                                @NonNull
                                                Class<? extends N> targetClass,
                                                @NonNull
                                                OverflowStrategy overflowStrategy,
                                                @NonNull
                                                RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Attempts to convert the given number to the target class, using loss-less conversions. If the conversion fails, applies the overflow strategy and returns the narrowed number.
        Type Parameters:
        N - The target type.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to convert.
        targetClass - the target class; cannot be null.
        overflowStrategy - the overflow strategy; cannot be null.
        roundingMode - the rounding mode; cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the narrowed number.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the number cannot be converted.

      • numberToInstant

        public static Instant numberToInstant(Number n,
                                      @NonNull
                                      TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                      @NonNull
                                      Instant epoch)
        Converts the given number into an Instant, expressed in the given time unit, and relative to the given epoch.
        Parameters:
        n - the number to parse, may be null.
        timeUnit - the time unit to use; cannot be null.
        epoch - the epoch to use; cannot be null.
        Returns:
        an Instant or null if the string was null or empty.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the number cannot be converted to a Long.
        DateTimeException - if the number is too large to be converted to an Instant.

      • instantToNumber

        public static long instantToNumber(@NonNull
                                   Instant instant,
                                   @NonNull
                                   TimeUnit timeUnit,
                                   @NonNull
                                   Instant epoch)
        Converts the given Instant into a scalar timestamp expressed in the given time unit and relative to the Unix Epoch.
        Parameters:
        instant - the instant to convert; cannot be null.
        timeUnit - the time unit to use; cannot be null.
        epoch - the epoch to use; cannot be null.
        Returns:
        a long representing the number of time units since the given epoch.

      • parseUUID

        public static UUID parseUUID(String s,
                             @NonNull
                             ConvertingCodec<String,Instant> instantCodec,
                             @NonNull
                             TimeUUIDGenerator generator)
        Parses the given string as a UUID.

        First, if the string is a UUID in canonical representation, parses the string using UUID.fromString(String). If that fails, then tries to parse the string as a temporal, then converts the temporal into a time UUID.

        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        instantCodec - the codec to use to parse temporals; cannot be null.
        generator - the generator to use to create a time UUIDl cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed UUID.

      • parseByteBuffer

        @Nullable
public static ByteBuffer parseByteBuffer(@Nullable
                                                   String s)
        Parses the given string as a ByteBuffer.

        First, tries to parse the string as a CQL blob literal in hexadecimal notation; if that fails, then tries to parse the string as a Base64-encoded byte array.

        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed ByteBuffer.

      • parsePoint

        public static Point parsePoint(String s)
        Parses the given string as a Point.

        This method tries the following string formats, and returns the first one that is able to parse the string:

        1. Well-known text;
        2. Geo JSON;
        3. Well-known binary with Base64 encoding;
        4. Well-known binary with hexadecimal encoding.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed Point, or null if the string was null or empty.

      • parseLineString

        public static LineString parseLineString(String s)
        Parses the given string as a LineString.

        This method tries the following string formats, and returns the first one that is able to parse the string:

        1. Well-known text;
        2. Geo JSON;
        3. Well-known binary with Base64 encoding;
        4. Well-known binary with hexadecimal encoding.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed LineString, or null if the string was null or empty.

      • parsePolygon

        public static Polygon parsePolygon(String s)
        Parses the given string as a Polygon.

        This method tries the following string formats, and returns the first one that is able to parse the string:

        1. Well-known text;
        2. Geo JSON;
        3. Well-known binary with Base64 encoding;
        4. Well-known binary with hexadecimal encoding.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed Polygon, or null if the string was null or empty.

      • parseDateRange

        public static DateRange parseDateRange(String s)
        Parses the given string as a DateRange.

        This method simply delegates to DateRange.parse(String), except when the string is null or empty, in which case it returns null.

        Parameters:
        s - the string to parse; may be null.
        Returns:
        the parsed DateRange, or null if the string was null or empty.
